p: The selected seven EOs have been screened for their antibacterial activities against P. acnes and S. epidermidis using the disc diffusion test. The results were represented as the diameter of inhibition zone ( Figure 1 and Table S1). P. acnes and S. epidermidis were susceptible to oregano and thyme EOs with a zone of inhibition (ZOI) ranging from 16 to 32 mm larger than those of erythromycin and clindamycin reference antibiotics ( Figure 1). While lemongrass and tea tree showed moderate ZOI from 9–17 mm, lavender, mentha, chamomile EOs failed to inhibit the growth of both bacteria ( Figure 1 and Table S1). The two studies’ positive controls (erythromycin and clindamycin) showed ZOI ranging from 10 to 20 mm. The negative control vehicle dimethylsulfoxide (DMSO) showed no inhibition against both bacteria.
